jobs.title: Director Sales DACH (w/m/d)
jobs.description:
Hi! We are Billie, the leading provider of “Buy Now, Pay Later” (BNPL) payment methods for businesses, offering B2B companies innovative digital payment services and modern checkout solutions. We are here to transform and upgrade the operating system of B2B Payments. Thus, we enable businesses to pay and get paid on their own terms, having the same frictionless and flexible experience as consumers are used to nowadays. To do so, our solutions are based on proprietary, machine-learning-supported risk models, fully digitized processes and a highly scalable tech platform. This makes us a deep-tech company building financial products, not the other way around. We love building simple and elegant solutions and we strive for automation and scalability. Our vision to create new freedom through innovation has attracted exciting strategic partners and highly experienced investors, making us join forces with Klarna and securing an outstanding $100 million Series C funding round nearly quadrupling our previous valuation. Our investors include VCs such as Dawn Capital, Creandum, Picus and SpeedInvest.

Join us to create the future of B2B payments!

ABOUT THE ROLE:

You will take over the leadership of our sales and account management team in Germany, our home market, co-developing and executing the go-to-market strategy of our fast growing Buy Now Pay Later product. You will set and be responsible for team targets and be the driving force behind building scalable processes that allow us to meet our ambitious goals for this and upcoming years. In addition, you will steer our exclusive BNPL-partnership with Klarna in Germany and be responsible for building scalable sales processes that allow us to meet our ambitious goals in the upcoming months and years.

Your main responsibilities:

  • Build a best-in-class sales and account management team with outstanding individuals, setting KPIs, sales metrics and financial targets designed to scale at speed
  • Co-define the go-to-market strategy together with VP Sales
  • Design and implement highly effective and scalable sales processes, that allow further scaling of the team
  • Own strategic key accounts and support closing multi-million EUR opportunities yourself
  • Drive projects and initiatives together with other departments (esp. Marketing, Brand & Communications, Product) to push visibility and growth within our target verticals

WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR:

  • 5+ years experience in B2B enterprise sales, out of which 2+ years in high-performing leadership role (Head of Sales, Team Lead Sales, etc.)
  • 3+ years experience in E-Commerce/Payments or an API-based product
  • Proven success in building and leading high-performing B2B sales teams
  • Strong competencies in pitching and closing Large Enterprise clients
  • Proven knowledge of different sales methodologies (strong knowledge of consultative selling, knowledge in selling complex products)
  • Fluent German and English language
  • Able to drive cross-functional alignment across sales, marketing and product teams
  • Ability to interpret data and derive actionable insights, build coherent measures and metrics to develop a best-in-class sales team
  • Proactive, self-starter by nature, contributing with new approaches that add value and innovation to Billie’s strategy and approach

WHAT WE OFFER YOU:

  • Flexible work hours and trust in your ability to deliver, empowering you to take control of your work-life balance.
  • Up to 6 weeks per year of “Workation”.
  • One of the best Virtual Shares Incentive Programs in the market, so that everyone at Billie is invested in our success.
  • Freedom to balance working from home and the office according to you and your team’s needs. No restrictions, only guidelines and a flexibility-first approach.
  • Our “Catch a Ride with Billie” program gives you a big discount on the Monthly Public Transport pass in Berlin.
  • A yearly development budget to broaden your skill set and horizons. We also offer free German group classes with your colleagues.
  • An English-speaking, multicultural team with more than 46 nationalities from all continents represented in our staff.
  • A one-time relocation bonus if you join us in Berlin.
  • A great office space near Checkpoint Charlie with free gym access, healthy snacks and cereals, fruit, coffee, soda, and beer.

Billie offers you the opportunity to be a part of one of the fastest-growing Fintech startups in Europe following the mission to innovate to create new freedom for businesses of all sizes. Our combined decades of experience in B2B Financing and Payments in a market thirsty for innovation and change make this a fantastic possibility to get into the most dynamic space in tech.

Join an international team of talented, passionate people where drive and merit matter. We work in nimble, cross-functional teams with open communication lines across the company. You’ll be surrounded by smart people from a wide variety of backgrounds from which you can learn and that want to learn from you.

Are you ready to join Billie?

  • Unser PC-Kassensystem handhabst Du mit Leichtigkeit – damit auch das Bezahlen für unsere Kunden und Kundinnen ein positives Erlebnis wird.
  • Und damit auch jede Kundin und jeder Kunde ihr/sein Lieblingsprodukt bekommt, bearbeitest Du die Warenlieferung zuverlässig und räumst jedes Produkt an den richtigen Platz.

Qualifikation

  • Zeitliche Flexibilität und Bereitschaft auch samstags zu arbeiten
  • Eine kontaktfreudige und sympathische Persönlichkeit, die stets den Kunden und Details im Blick hat, sehr gepflegt auftritt und gerne gemeinsam mit motivierten Kolleginnen und Kollegen unsere Boutique erfolgreicher macht!
  • Eine abgeschlossene Ausbildung im Einzelhandel oder in der Kosmetik. Auch als Quereinsteiger:in mit Verkaufstalent bist Du bei uns herzlich willkommen
  • Ein Plus, aber kein Muss: Kenntnisse einer Fremdsprache, wie Englisch oder Französisch

Benefits

Damit du erholt bleibst:

  • Ein unbefristeter Vertrag
  • 6 Wochen Urlaub, Sonderurlaubstag(e) für Umzug, Heirat, die Geburt eures Kindes oder im Trauerfall

Damit du fit bleibst:

Damit deine Karriere auf dem neusten Stand bleibt:

Wir haben Dein Interesse für die Stelle geweckt? Super. Dann nutz die Chance und bewirb Dich hier und jetzt, wir freuen uns auf Deine aussagekräftige Bewerbung!

L'OCCITANE ist ein Arbeitgeber der Chancengleichheit, der eine Politik der Gleichberechtigung verfolgt. Wir behandeln alle Bewerbungen gleich und rekrutieren neue Mitarbeiter:innen auf Basis ihrer Fähigkeiten und Erfahrungen. Unser Ziel ist es, einen diversen Arbeitsplatz zu schaffen, frei von Diskriminierung und Belästigung, wo sich jede:r respektiert und wertgeschätzt fühlt. In diesem Zusammenhang stellen wir Menschen mit einem positiven Mindset ein, die unsere Unternehmenswerte und unser Engagement für Inkludierung und Nachhaltigkeit unterstützen.

jobs.title: Recruiter (m/f/d) - Remote in Germany
jobs.description:
Are you passionate to help people find the perfect job and eager to build a company where people thrive? Would you like to take full ownership of the recruitment lifecycle and join our exciting journey of scaling our team from 35 to 70 employees within the next 12 months? Here's your chance!

Tasks

As our internal recruiter, you will contribute to building a diverse company with an outstanding culture together with Celine & Ivanna. You will work closely with our hiring managers and are responsible for the operational recruiting process for numerous positions in areas such as Sales, Marketing, Customer Success and Tech. By actively sourcing the best passive candidates in the global market you ensure high-quality talent pipelines. If you also value a high level of teamwork, commitment and open communication - let's talk! :)

What a week at ELISE could look like:

  • You work in close collaboration with the hiring managers to identify the hiring needs and gain a deep understanding of the requirements for each open position.
  • You take end-to-end ownership for talent acquisition: source candidates, review resumes, screen & interview candidates, negotiate and move the interviewing process forward.
  • You help all hiring managers to succeed in conducting interviews by giving an interview and unconscious-bias trainings.
  • You derive metrics from our TA efforts and pipeline development to allow for data-driven decision-making.
  • You partner with the founders and your HR colleagues to set up hiring strategies and deeply understand hiring needs.
  • You provide an outstandingly positive candidate experience throughout the hiring process.
  • You continuously work to improve our hiring process and find new ways to attract talent.

Requirements

  • You are located in Germany.
  • You have already gained profound experiences in Recruiting and Talent acquisition. Experience in tech & engineering roles is a big plus.
  • You have a knack for assessing talent and leveraging proven and validated methods to do so.
  • You are a self-starter who enjoys working independently.
  • You can organize yourself and your workflow well, even when you have a lot on your plate. Having worked in a fast-paced environment is a plus.
  • You are a very focused and process-driven person and continuously work to improve existing processes.
  • You are a confident and to-the-point communicator, able to attract and win over passive candidates and excite them about ELISE.
  • You are fluent in English.

Benefits

  • Freedom to use your creativity/expertise and implement new processes & state of the art recruitment practices.
  • You will take on a high level of responsibility right from the start.
  • Possibility to join our digital coaching program via Coachhub.
  • We don't believe in one-fits-all solutions and therefore let you decide when & where to work (as long as you have a residency in Germany).
  • Need time to recharge your batteries? No problem - talk to your team and take as much time off as you like. We don't count your vacation days as we trust all our team members to decide what's best for them and the company.
  • Flexible public holidays, swap days off according to your values and beliefs.
  • In case you'll work remotely, we'll help you get set up at home and invite you to come and visit Bremen from time to time.
  • Spend time together with your colleagues during regular team events or spontaneous afterworks :-) For summer & Christmas, we usually get together with the whole company to spend 2-3 days somewhere nice!
  • Use your yearly budget of 2.000€ or buy interesting books with our business account to develop yourself. You’ll also have the chance to grow together with us!

P.S. ELISE is a place where everyone can grow. So however you identify and whatever background you bring with you, please apply if this is a role that would make you excited to come to work every day. We highly value your application even if you cannot tick off all the boxes of our job description :-)

jobs.title: Controller Operations (f/m/d)
jobs.description:
Job description

As Controller Operations (f/m/d) you will be the strategic business partner to our operations team driving actionable initiatives and enabling global operations. With your experience, knowledge and efforts, you will play a crucial role in the operational excellence and efficiency of the world's most innovative young company for battery technology.

In a fabless environment, and acting as a turntable between operations teams and accounting, we are looking for a technical expert to:

  • Take ownership of the cost of goods sold. Along with procurement and product owners, you will ensure that our COGS and gross margin remain at a competitive level
  • Monitor and forecast production output levels of contract manufacturers and highlight market or supply-chain mismatches
  • Plan annual output levels, CoGS, operating expenses as well as capital expenditures for budget and financial planning purposes
  • Enable operations with project costing, grant applications, warranty cost calculations etc.
  • Manage annual and rolling stock take

Requirements

  • You have an academic degree BA/BS with major in Accounting or Finance, ideally coupled with a management accounting qualification such as CIMA or equivalent.
  • You have a strong technical background, gained via solid experience (min. 3 years) in manufacturing / physical goods industries.
  • You are tech-savvy and use systems to become more efficient. Experience with Netsuite/Oracle is an advantage.
  • You are solution-oriented, very reliable and work in a structured way.
  • You are equally fluent in German and English.
  • You have superior communication skills to ensure that Finance mixes well with other teams.

What we offer

As an employer, it is important for us to provide our employees with freedom and resources to give them maximum influence on the success of the team and the company. In particular, you can:

  • shape the company by contributing with your individual strengths and ideas.
  • grow your skills within a world-class team.
  • see how a vision becomes reality.
  • experience the unique atmosphere of our offices or work from home.
  • benefit from a family-friendly work environment and take control of your workday.

At instagrid, we are deeply committed to equal employment opportunities as we believe in the power of diverse teams. We do not just accept diversity but actively search for the best talent regardless of gender, race, age, religion, sexual orientation, place of origin, or disabilities. Working as a team, we treat each other with respect and value each other’s opinions to achieve our common goals.

Sounds like you? We are looking forward to receiving your application!

jobs.title: Email Marketing Automation Manager (Email Agency)
jobs.description:
Job description

Hi there!
We are Semrush, a global IT company developing our own product – a platform for digital marketers.

And this is our Email & Marketing Automation Manager role for idea generators, planning geniuses, and natural-born analysts.

Tasks in the role

  • Manage automated email programs, support the customer lifecycle (engage, convert, up-sell/cross-sell).
  • Work closely with internal partners, including business, engineering, design, legal, and bringing ideas to life that increase user engagement with the product.
  • Optimize email programs end-to-end, including concept development, audience segmentation, email deployment, performance reporting, and ongoing testing.
  • Work with cross-functional teams to ensure on-time and high-quality delivery of initiatives by balancing business needs versus technical constraints.
  • Execute thoughtful experiments to unlock high-impact programs, and leverage automation to maximize user engagement & retention.
  • Analyze email program results, make recommendations & implement changes based on key findings.
  • Provide task requesters with email analytics (custom reports, analysis of sent-out email).
  • Provide departments with best email practices of industries (content performance, technical implementation, trigger scenarios).

Requirements

Who we are looking for

  • Solid expertise in triggered/automated marketing programs and workflows.
  • Proven experience with Marketo is a must.
  • Extensive knowledge of customer journeys, lifecycle campaigns, and segmented communication strategies.
  • Strong analytical skills, understanding of A/B testing, ability to draw conclusions from data and act accordingly.
  • In-depth knowledge of email best practices to increase deliverability, engagement, and conversions.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills, a proven ability to lead day-to-day relationships, and work with multiple contacts successfully.
  • Work experience as a client-facing account manager at an agency is a plus.
  • Highly motivated and able to work in a fast-paced, deadline-sensitive, detail-driven environment.
  • Great team spirit; strong communication and collaborative skills.

We will try to create all the right conditions for you to work and rest comfortably

  • Low cost medical, dental, and vision plans.
  • Dependent Care Savings Accounts and Flexible Spending Accounts.
  • Employee Assistance Program.
  • 401(k) plan with flexible ways to save and fully vested employer match up to 4%
  • Generous PTO (Vacation, Floating Holidays and Paid Sick Time).
  • Paid parental leave.
  • Employee Stock Purchase Program.
  • Short-term and Long-term Disability.
  • Accidental death and dismemberment (AD&D) insurance, Life Insurance.
  • Travel Insurance.
  • Corporate Events.
  • Snacks, coffee, tea

Finally, a little more about our company

Semrush is a leading online visibility management SaaS platform that enables businesses globally to run search engine optimization, pay-per-click, content, social media and competitive research campaigns and get measurable results from online marketing.

We've been developing our product for 13 years and have been awarded G2's Top 100 Software Products, Global and US Search Awards 2021, Great Place to Work Certification, Deloitte Technology Fast 500 and many more. In March 2021 Semrush went public and started trading on the NYSE with the SEMR ticker.

10,000,000+ users in America, Europe, Asia, and Australia have already tried Semrush, and over 1,000 people around the world are working on its development. The Semrush team is constantly growing.

Our new colleague, we are waiting for you!

Semrush is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, creed, color, national origin, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, ancestry, physical or mental disability, or medical condition including medical characteristics, genetic identity, marital status, military service, or any other classification protected by applicable local, state or federal laws. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements, merit and individual qualifications.

Branche: Medizintechnikhersteller

Für unseren Mandanten, ein international tätiges Familienunternehmen, das sich auf die Herstellung und den Vertrieb hochwertiger Produkte im Bereich der Medizintechnik spezialisiert hat, suchen wir Sie als Bilanzbuchhalter (m/w/d) Medizintechnik.

Aufgaben

  • Eigenständige Erledigung von Abschlussarbeiten und der zugehörigen Konsolidierung nach IFRS als SAP-Key-User
  • Bearbeitung von komplexeren Geschäftsvorfällen, Konten- und Intercompany-Abstimmung
  • Klärung von bilanziellen und steuerrechtlichen Fragen
  • Ansprechpartner für interne Abteilungen, Tochtergesellschaften, Steuerberater und Wirtschaftsprüfer
  • Mitwirkung bei der Buchhaltung des Tagesgeschäfts inklusive des Zahlungsverkehrs
  • Unterstützung bei der Weiterentwicklung der Finanz- und Bilanzierungsprozesse und Übernahme von Sonderprojekten

Qualifikation

  • Betriebswirtschaftliches Studium bzw. kaufmännische Berufsausbildung, z.B. als Steuerfachangestellter (m/w/d), Industriekaufmann (m/w/d), Kaufmann für Büromanagement (m/w/d) mit eine Weiterbildung zum Bilanzbuchhalter (m/w/d)
  • Mindestens 5 Jahre praktische Erfahrung im Accounting
  • Routinierter Umgang mit SAP, idealerweise erste Erfahrung mit SAP SEM-BCS
  • Kenntnisse in der Rechnungslegung nach HGB (idealerweise auch IFRS) und in den Bereichen Umsatzsteuer, Reisekosten und Ertragssteuern
  • Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse sowie ein ausgeprägtes IT-Verständnis

Benefits

  • Unbefristetes Arbeitsverhältnis und langfristige Entwicklungsperspektive
  • Flexible Vertrauensarbeitszeit
  • Homeoffice-Option mit bis zu 3 Tagen Homeoffice/Woche
  • 30 Tage Urlaub, betriebliche Altersversorgung und vermögenswirksame Leistungen (nach 2 Jahren Betriebszugehörigkeit: Zukaufmöglichkeit von bis zu 10 weiteren Urlaubstagen)
  • Vielfältige Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten

kununu Score / BleckmannSchulze: 4,9 - Weiterempfehlung: 100 %: Kompetent, professionell, sehr gute Betreuung vom Anfang bis zum Ende" (Bewertung Bewerber - November 2021).

Bewerben Sie sich jetzt und erfahren Sie mehr über weitere interessante Jobangebote als Bilanzbuchhalter (m/w/d) in Köln und Umgebung!

jobs.title: (Senior) Art Director, Digital (d/f/m)
jobs.description:
Highsnobiety is a brand dedicated to the latest in style, culture, and the community pushing them forward. We don't just report on what's happening — we are shaping it. From industry deep dives to product curations to our very own in-house garments, our goal is to bring you not anything and everything, but only the best of the best on all fronts. And we want you to be a part of that!

We are looking for a (Senior) Art Director, Digital to join our team in Berlin. The ideal candidate is experienced in web and digital design with a strong sense of typography and branded storytelling. Previous working experience in the Fashion and Lifestyle sector in an Agency environment is a big plus.

Tasks

  • Design engaging interactive stories and microsites for us and our brand partners
  • Examples: IWC Roadshow
  • Nike Purpose
  • Semi-Permanent
  • Develop and execute creative concepts for digital with our Creative team
  • Work closely with our Product Manager and Frontend Engineers to bring projects to life
  • Create reusable design elements for visual storytelling

Requirements

  • At least 4 years of experience working as a designer/art director
  • 1-3 years of experience working with digital/web design/UX
  • Great understanding and constant consideration of Highsnobiety visual language, audience and clients integrated into your daily tasks
  • Strong typographic and typesetting skills
  • Expert at Figma or Sketch
  • Enthusiastic about visual storytelling and staying up to date with the latest design trends
  • Proficient motion design and animation experience
  • High demands for quality and an eye for details
  • Experience developing creative concepts for clients
  • Ability to accurately estimate task and project timelines
  • Design quality assurance (QA)
  • Proficient understanding of the web: HTML & CSS
  • Bonus: experience with After Effects or 3d software, experience with NFTs /Web3 projects

Benefits

  • A comprehensive COVID-19 remote work plan and related sustainable business model
  • A bright and spacious Design office, which reflects our brand and focuses on employee well-being, located in the upcoming and vibrant district of Schöneberg
  • Motivating, international and creative work atmosphere
  • High degree of responsibility, creativity, originality, independence and creative leeway
  • The opportunity to proactively shape a company and help build a global brand
  • Competitive compensation (incl. visa/relocation support)
  • Attractive employee benefits (e.g. various discounts)

We’re looking forward to hearing from you!!

Highsnobiety is a global community of independent-minded creatives & professionals: Every perspective matters. That’s why we’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression or genetic information
